sentences.sContent: Don’t cry, Laura. It’ll be OK.
Upstairs, a baby began to cry.
sentences.sCn: 楼上有个婴儿开始哭起来。

sentences.sContent: Jamie looked like he’d been crying.
sentences.sCn: 杰米看上去好像哭过了。

sentences.sContent: That film always makes me cry .
sentences.sCn: 那部影片总是让我落泪。

sentences.sContent: Oliver, alone, began to cry bitterly (= cry a lot ) .
sentences.sCn: 奥利弗独自一人，开始伤心地哭了。

sentences.sContent: ...stop and reflect on why we cry and what it means to cry...
...Women cry more frequently and intensely than men...
...Infants cry to attract attention for survival...
...could not prove that animals cry tears from emotion...
...he also just liked to cry over nothing...
...People are more inclined to cry when suffering minor forms of depression...
...People who score on personality tests as more sympathetic cry more than those who are more rigid or have more self-control...
...and tend more frequently to apologize when they cry openly...
